entry.title: 2H 2025 Release Highlights of SAP Best Practices for SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting Management
entry.content:
Dear all,

Hope you are doing fine.

We are excited to share news about the Best Practices package for Recruiting Management 2H 2025 via the upgrade center. We have some new features that help you adopt the latest product enhancements quickly, improve user experience, and make it easy for you to adjust, test, and demo.

Disclaimer: Please note these features are currently available only on preview. The final version will be updated on RTC or production date for 2H 2025.

But before starting, let us share how you can find our Best Practices packages. In the Upgrade Center, filter for SAP Best Practices, and observe that the packages are listed under Recommended Upgrades:

Adopting the Unified Data Model for Career Site Builder

To align with SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting product strategy, Best Practices Recruiting packages now adopt the Unified Data Model (UDM) as of release 2511. The UDM standardizes how job data is defined, exposed, and consumed across Recruiting Management and Career Site Builder (CSB), reducing configuration overhead and paving the way for faster innovation.

In Best Practices Recruiting packages, we provide a range of pre-configurations and sample files for you to utilize the Unified Data Model more quickly and easily. The Following are detailed introductions to each configuration point:

Pre-delivered Job Location Long Format

We deliver two sample Job Location Long Formats for US and UK in the Best Practices Recruiting package, you can add more Job Location Long Formats for other countries based on these examples.

Pre-delivered Job Location Short Format

We deliver two sample Job Location Short Formats in the Best Practices Recruiting package, one for the US and one for all other countries.

Additionally, we deliver a business rule to define the condition for triggering the Job Location Short Formats based on the Country selection in the Job Requisition. This rule is assigned to the job requisition template as an Initialize Rule.

Job Location Fields in Job Requisition Template

We add Job Location-related fields and corresponding permissions in the Best Practices pre-delivered Job Requisition Templates: Pipeline Job Requisition, Standard Job Requisition (Integrated with Position Management) (For EC and Onboarding integration), and Standard Job Requisition (for Recruiting standalone). The recruiter can select Job Location when working on a Job Requisition, and the selected Job Location data will be shown in Career Site Builder with the rule-triggered Short Format and country-specific Long Format.

Updated Business Rule for Recruiting and Position Field Mapping

This update is only relevant to the Recruiting Integrated with Position Management scope. In Best Practices Recruiting package, we pre-deliver a busines rule, SFCC_MapReqFields, to automatically retrieve position field values for the job requisition when creating a job requisition from the Position Org Chart. In case the Unified Data Model enabled, we add a field mapping to get Location data from the Position into the Job Location field in the job requisition.

Pre-delivered Sample Job Location and State/Province Data

To support an out-of-the-box process, we deliver sample Job Location data for the US and UK, as well as sample State/Province data. You can use them to run processes directly for your demo or testing. You can also migrate your own location data to the Job Location and State/Province objects.

 

Sample Career Site Builder Import XML

To support the Unified Data Model, we provide a Unified Data Model-enabled sample Career Site Builder XML for you to import. For customers who cannot enable the Unified Data Model due to Career Site Builder server location limitations, you can still use the non-Unified Data Model sample Career Site Builder XML that we provide.

You can get these example XML files from the Configuration File Link on the SAP Best Practices for SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting page in the SAP Help Portal.

Enabled Reimaged Candidate Experience

The Best Practices enable Reimaged Candidate Experience feature, allowing you to adopt a seamless, efficient, and user-friendly application process designed to enhance engagement for both internal and external candidates. All of the Best Practices Recruiting Package Test Scripts have been updated accordingly to reflect the UI changes in the Guided Application Experience, My Applications, and My Profile, each offering Reimaged Candidate Experience features that work together to optimize the candidate journey.

To summarize, these best practices add a lot of value in terms of accelerating your implementations, and we hope to see more adoption from you (partners) in the coming days.  In case you have feedback, please do leave a comment below.

Thank you for your attention.

Best Regards, Tracy

entry.title: ONB Custom Task Workflow and Notification Management
entry.content:
Overview / Business challenges:

The client required multiple custom tasks to be executed like a workflow by different stakeholders as part of the Onboarding process. A simple example is the “Medical Checkup process”: one stakeholder had to initiate the medical check, another had to review the onboardee’s submission, and finally, the medical team had to verify the outcome.

In standard SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, custom tasks behave as standalone entities. They are not inherently designed to pass from one stakeholder to another. We ran into two main issues while working on this:

  • Interlinked Task Sequencing – The system doesn’t really allow you to chain custom tasks together. Each one works as a standalone item, so there was no simple way to say “only start Task 2 once Task 1 is done.” This broke the idea of a phased workflow and made the process feel disjointed.
  • Targeted Notifications – The standard “Custom Task Completion Trigger” sends notifications to every configured recipient each time a task is completed. This quickly became an issue because it meant previously completed tasks were included in the notification again. We needed the email to go only to the next stakeholder in line. Earlier stakeholders shouldn’t get another copy, and each person should only be notified when it’s actually their turn to act.


1. Problem Statement: Interlinked Task Sequencing:

Business Need:

Some activities (like approvals, background checks, or verifications) weren’t meant to stop with one person. They had to move step by step across multiple stakeholders. Each phase was handled by a different owner, but from a business standpoint it was still one activity, not a bunch of unrelated tasks.

Limitation in Standard System:

  1. In SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, custom tasks operate independently and are not linked to each other.
  2. They cannot be inherently connected or “aware” of each other’s progress.
  3. There is no native mechanism to reflect that “Task A is completed, now Task B should be assigned.”

Proposed Solution:

  1. We created a dropdown field called Status on the custom task.
  2. The options — Initiated, Completed, Approved, and Rejected — were used to show what stage the task was in at any point.
  3. To represent the task in multiple phases, we created separate custom tasks for each stakeholder. All tasks were linked to the same custom MDF base object (with External Code = User), ensuring data continuity across tasks and giving the appearance of an workflow.
  4. This made it appear as if the task was “passing” from one stakeholder to the next, rather than being multiple disconnected tasks.

Configuration:

Creation of Object:

Create the base object for the custom Task as per requirement:


Creation of tasks:

After creating Custom MDF Object definitions, a Custom Task Definition should be created.

As an admin Go to Manage Onboarding and Offboarding Tasks -> Task Setting (Tab) -> Click on New Task under Manage Custom Tasks Section to open "Add a New Custom Task".

Module: Onboarding (as our Task is associated to Onboarding Process)
Custom Task Name: PreEmployment Medical Test
Custom MDF Object: Medical Fitness (cust_MedicalFitness)

        


Click on “Open Template Editor” and make changes as needed:
 

 

Similarly create another custom task with the same base object:

Custom Task Name: PreEmployment Medical Test (Onboardee)
Custom MDF Object: Medical Fitness (cust_MedicalFitness)

 
And another for the medical team:

Custom Task Name: PreEmployment Medical Test- Medical Team
Custom MDF Object: Medical Fitness (cust_MedicalFitness)

 

            

 

NOTE: Basically, we used the same MDF Object, but created different tasks, each for a different stakeholder.

 

Then add the custom tasks to the desired Onboarding Program:


Assign the responsible group against each task as per the requirement.

 

 

 

3. Problem Statement: Targeted Notifications

Business Need:

The client wanted phase-specific notifications. So, once someone finished a task, the next stakeholder should get a notification, that they need to action on the task. Otherwise, people were seeing notifications about tasks they had already done, which was confusing.

Limitation in Standard System:

The standard “(ONB) Custom Task Completion Trigger” doesn’t look at task order or completion status of the task at all. Every time a new task gets completed, it just fires emails for all the old tasks again. That was messy — everyone was getting duplicates, and it was hard to figure out what step was actually pending.

Consider the following Medical Test activity which is split into three custom tasks:

  • Medical Test – Initiation (Onboarding Team)
  • Medical Test – Form Submission (Onboardee)
  • Medical Test – Verification (Medical Team)

This is what happens with standard behavior:

  • When the Onboarding Team finishes "Initiation", the Onboardee gets the email, which works fine.
  • When the Onboardee completes "Form Submission", the system fires emails for both "Initiation" and "Form Submission", instead of just notifying the Medical Team.
  • When the Medical Team completes "Verification", the system sends emails for all three tasks again.

The result is a lot of duplicate notifications, and it’s hard for anyone to tell which step is actually pending.


Proposed Solution:

To overcome this limitation:

  1. We added a Status dropdown field to the custom task. This shows what phase the task is in — Initiated, Completed by Onboardee, or Completed by Medical Team.
  2. Then we put in business rules so that when someone finishes a task, only the next person in line gets an email. Nobody else gets notified again, and there are no duplicate messages.
  3. Distinct email templates were created for each step, ensuring that each stakeholder receives a clear, context-specific notification at the right time.

With this setup:

  • Once Initiation is completed, only the Onboardee gets the email.
  • After the Onboardee completes their part, the email goes only to the Medical Team.
  • After the Medical Team verifies, the process is over and nothing else gets sent.

This keeps the notifications simple and in order. Everyone only sees what they need to do, no duplicate notifications, no confusion.


Configuration:

Status Field with dropdown value:

Added a custom “Status” dropdown field on the custom task to track the phases — Initiated, Completed by Onboardee, Completed by Medical Team.

Example:


NOTE: Custom Tasks do not support picklists. So we had to make a separate MDF object and enter the values manually in Manage Data.

 

Email Templates:

We’re using the standard email trigger “(ONB) Custom Task Completion Trigger” for sending notifications. But distinct email templates were created for each step, ensuring that each stakeholder receives a clear, context-specific notification at the right time.

For example:

 

 

 

Business Rules to filter Email Template:

And business rules were set up to check the exact phase at completion and trigger only the next phase’s email.

Scenario: Filter Email Template

Assigned:

 

Assigned:


NOTE: Similar to how the "(ONB) Custom Task Completion Trigger" resends notifications for all previously completed tasks when a new one is finished, the "(ONB) Custom Task Assignment Trigger" behaves in a cumulative way and can generate initiation emails for every stakeholder in workflow sequence.

We made the assignment trigger fire only for the first stakeholder. That way, the assignment email goes out just at the start. After that, all the next emails are handled by the completion trigger. Each stakeholder sees their own phase email only once, no duplicates or extra messages.

entry.title: Salesforce adapter (ROJO) returning a blank exception
entry.content:
Hello All,

I am currently encountering an issue with the upsert operation using ExternalID through the ROJO Salesforce adapter, which is connected via the Request-Reply element. Specifically, the Salesforce upsert operation fails for some records in the clustered payload, resulting in a blank exception, while other records are processed successfully. This integration flow functioned perfectly during QA testing; however, it is now failing in the production environment without any changes made to the integration flow.

I have already attempted to resolve the issue by updating to the latest version of the adapter, but the problem persists.

I would greatly appreciate any guidance or solutions that could assist in resolving this matter.

Thank You

entry.title: Is there a way to include values from multiple models in an input control?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

In SAP Analytics Cloud stories, when displaying multiple models in a single chart,
there is a requirement to display multiple models within a single input control.

By setting linked dimensions in the story,
you can add linked dimensions to the chart.
However, no similar functionality is found in the input controls.

For example, regarding the two models below, when creating an input control named COMPANYCODE,
we want the company code values TEST and TEST2 to be displayed.
However, since currently only one model can be specified per input control,
this requires two separate input controls—one displaying only TEST and another displaying only TEST2.


Is there a way to use values from multiple models for a single input control?


If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.
Thanks best regards.

entry.title: Inconsistent Default Instructor role - Print attendance sheet VS Print roster
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community

I am looking for some guidance for the issue below

Context: We are Transitioning  one Agency's  Learning solution from their SuccessFactors Instance to Our SuccessFactors Instance with scheduled Go-Live this month-end.

 

Issue Description: We found that the Default Instructor Role in our systems have inconsistent permissions.

Since this role is hard-coded and we cannot update it, we aren’t able to understand the cause of this inconsistency

 

Please refer to the screenshots below, for DPHI and OOS SuccessFactors learning. The yellow highlighted permissions are common in both. The discrepancies

DPHI instance has the permission “Print attendance sheet” which is not in OOS LMS, while OOS LMS has the permission “Print roster”

We have also checked the available workflows in both system’s the Default Instructor role and didn’t find these roles there 

Question:  We have NOT implemented Virtual Learning System, however, the other Agency has, hence we are ignoring the permission ‘Edit Virtual Learning Account”. Can that be the reason for the inconsistency?

Please advise on how to resolve this inconsistency or any possible workaround.

 

Our DEFAULT INSTRUCTOR Role (LAR0018 is the copied role from the DEFAULT INSTRUCTOR role)

 

 

The other Agency's Default Instructor Role

 

Regards

Sunita

entry.title: How to identify a Corporate IDP in the URL when using the DynamicIdentityProvider in SAP AppRouter
entry.content:
We are in the process of building a custom application which will be used by both employees and customers and therefore want to have each group authenticate against their respective Corporate IDP.

The custom CAP application is deployed into a BTP subacccount which has been configured with the trust to the SAP Cloud Identity Service (lets call it "SAP CIS External") instance intended specifically for this externally facing application.  We have a separate SAP Cloud Identity Service (lets call it "SAP CIS Internal") which is used for employee authentication by this application and other applications including Fiori for internal use only.

The "SAP CIS External" has 2 Corporate IDPs configured:

  1. ADFS - to be used for authenticating external customers. Configured as the default 'Corporate IDP'
  2. "SAP CIS Internal" - to be used for authenticating employees

Based on the following documentation, I understand that I should be able to use a URL to direct authentication to "SAP CIS Internal" as the 'alternate' Corporate IDP,  thus not using the default Corporate IDP configured. This would allow customers to use the 'default' Corporate IDP while internal employees will be provided a specific URL for them to access this application using our internal IDP.

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/sap-business-technology-platform/environment-variables?locale=en-US
    • Refer: 'DYNAMIC_IDENTITY_PROVIDER' Environment variable
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/create-url-to-access-saml-oidc-application-with-specific-identity-provider
  • https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sap/approuter#dynamic-identity-provider-configuration

Questions:

  1. What is the name of the 'Corporate IDP' I should be using for the URI parameter 'sap_idp'?
    • Based on the documentation it states that the 'Display Name' should not be used, but there is no alternative name. Neither work anyway.
    • The examples provided show the usage of a protocol and domain (eg. sap_idp=https://corp_idp_2.mydomain.com) but does not indicate how to source this value. Multiple values have been tested and do not work.
  2. How should the Dynamic Identity Provider setting be configured as my current configuration is not working?
    1. Configured the 'route' in our AppRouter to have the setting =>  "dynamicIdentityProvider": true
    2. Set the environment variable "DYNAMIC_IDENTITY_PROVIDER" in the AppRouter CAP in subaccount and space to have a value of => true

entry.title: Re: Transport app to another BTP subaccount
entry.content:
@tskwin wrote:

Hi Community,
how can I transport an app (e.g. SAP IAS) from one BTP subaccount to another ?

Thanks for your help.

 

Best Regards

Hello @tskwin,
You can transport SAP IAS configurations using SAP BTP's Transport Management Service (TMS). Set up TMS in both subaccounts, export the app or configuration, and import it into the target subaccount. Make sure both subaccounts are in the same global account and have proper entitlements.


Best Regards,
Jill Muncy

entry.title: Using Embedded SAC to Analyze cross-feature Sales & Service Scenarios
entry.content:
In today’s data-driven world, businesses need instant access to actionable insights that can guide smarter decisions. For organizations using SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management, the Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) capabilities deliver just that—enabling seamless, cross-feature analysis directly within your operational systems.

Embedded SAC allows business and admin users to design both simple and complex queries across multiple data sources. Whether you’re analyzing sales performance, service operations, or end-to-end process flows, Embedded SAC helps you visualize and understand your data—without needing external analytics tools.

Simplify Analytics with Query Designer

At the core of this capability lies the Query Designer—a powerful tool that provides access to all available data sources within your SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP Enterprise Service Management environment.

With Query Designer, you can:

  • Explore master and transactional data sources
  • View how these data sources are pre-joined and delivered out of the box
  • Build custom cross-feature queries tailored to your business needs

SAP provides detailed documentation on how to view and link your data sources through the Query Designer. You can explore it here.

Creating Custom Joins Between Data Sources

Beyond standard joins, admin users can define custom joins between data sources that are not automatically linked. This is achieved using the “Joins” dialog in the Query Designer—accessible from the toolbar or via contextual links within the interface, as illustrated in this video: https://sapvideo.cfapps.eu10-004.hana.ondemand.com/?entry_id=1_4njrmc5o

Using this feature, you can connect data sources based on:

  • Primary key fields, or
  • Extension fields that function as keys

For more details on creating Free Joins, refer to SAP’s documentation here.

There are two primary join types available:

  • All Primary Data (Left-Outer Join) – retains all records from the primary dataset
  • Intersecting Data (Inner Join) – includes only records common to both datasets

 Analyzing End-to-End Business Processes

Where this feature truly stands out is in its ability to link data sources along process chains—enabling comprehensive analysis across parts of the “Lead to Cash” or “Service to Cash” flows which are supported within SAP Sales Cloud V2 or SAP Service Cloud V2.

You can achieve this by creating joins between related entities such as:

  • Lead Related Object
  • Opportunity Related Entity
  • Case Related Object

To determine which data sources can be joined, execute these related data sources and review fields such as “Related Entity Type”. This approach helps you map potential joins and build a holistic view of your business processes.

Building Complex Queries for Deep Insights

Once you’ve defined your joins, you can integrate them within the main Query Designer pane to create multi-layered, complex queries. For example, you might design a query that analyzes all related entities of a Lead—offering a complete perspective on how leads progress through your sales pipeline.

The result? A unified, insightful view of your operational data that empowers business leaders to make informed decisions faster, as can been seen in the complex data model below.

Conclusion

With Embedded SAP Analytics Cloud, you’re not just visualizing data—you’re unlocking a deeper understanding of your business. From standard dashboards to complex process analyses, this powerful embedded capability helps organizations drive agility, efficiency, and growth.

By leveraging the Query Designer and custom join capabilities, CRM administrators and business users alike can transform raw data into meaningful, actionable insights—directly within the SAP ecosystem.

entry.title: Payment Receipt_KSeF Reference Number Auto Update/populate
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I would like to understand the standard approach for implementing the KSeF Poland E-Invoicing process in SAP, specifically regarding the inclusion of the KSeF ID in the reference number field of payment receipts posted in the backend system.

As per the regulatory expectations, the KSeF ID should be traceable in the payment documentation. Could you please advise:

  • What is the recommended method to capture and store the KSeF ID in SAP?
  • Is there a standard field or enhancement point in the payment receipt process to include this ID?
  • Are there any best practices or SAP Notes related to this integration?

Any guidance or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated.

Tess

We are trying to access the UserSystemInfos entity set from the SSAM Service in a Dynamic Form,

We followed the steps in the documentation “Accessing SAP Service and Asset Manager Data Using Services and Actions” (https://help.sap.com/docs/dynamic-forms/form-builder-developer-guide/accessing-sap-service-and-asset-manager-data-using-services-and-actions). However, after completing all the steps, we are receiving the following test result:

"No headers received."

Below is what we configured:

        Step 1: HTTP Service Editor

  • Service Name: SSAM-First-Name

  • Resource URL: /fr/service/custom/entityset/UserSystemInfos

  • Method: GET

  • Serialization: HTML Form

  • URL Parameters: SystemSettingGroup eq 'HR.USER' and SystemSettingName eq 'FIRSTNAME'



    Step 2: Actions Editor
    Configured actions based on the documentation.
       

     

    Test Results


    Could you please advise how we can resolve this issue? Any suggestions or insights would be greatly appreciated.
    Thank you in advance.

    Best regards,
    Kigston A.

entry.title: Re: API or function to Reject CR of BP in MDG
entry.content:
@Kevin_zzj 

The development placeholder I was referring to is different from the one currently in use.

To make it work as intended, the user needs to be included in the Rule-based Workflow — specifically in the User Agent Decision Table. The Single Value Decision Table step must be configured with a reject action and status update. Once that's done, the combination I mentioned earlier will function correctly.

Best regards,
Sandeep Suggu.

entry.title: Advice on Payment Term Configuration in OBB8
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts,

I have question on how to achieve these scenarios from OBB8 configuration:

1. Invoice dated 15 August 2025 with document due on 31.10.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Entitle for % discount (Pass)
2. Invoice dated 15 July 2025 with document due on 30.09.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Not entitle for discount (Failed - SAP still showing discount for this document)
3. Invoice dated 15 October 2025 - Shouldn't appear in F110 payment listing (Pass)
 
I have set configuration Payment term Z061:
Term 1: Percentage (1.5%) / Fixed Date (31) / Additional Months (2) - which is failed at 2nd scenario.
 
From my understanding, this vendor only has 1 term.
Due date must always EOM + 2 Months together with discount. If the document is paid after due, no discount should apply at F110.

entry.title: Re: Calling an external web service via https using the system certificate store
entry.content:
I provided the text of my web service and an example of its call above.

Since it is called "POST and x-www-form-urlencoded", it has a body, which is supposed to transfer parameters to the web service. For some reason, it is not in the log of this body (maybe SQL Anywhere does not write it to the log?), but the log contains the field “Content-Length: 99” — as I understand it, this shows that everything is still being transferred to the web service.

entry.title: Re: How the Due Date and Reminder determined in task of C...
entry.content: Please feel free to ask further queries here.

entry.title: Re: How the Due Date and Reminder determined in task of C...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

If the settings in the Fine Tuning Activity Business Task Management for Contracts and Customer Returns for the date is set as 60 Days before Contract End Date and the settings in the Reminder field of the Contract is set as 30 Days, then a reminder is sent on 60 days before the Contract End Date as this is the earlier date. However, if these were switched, it would be sent because of what is maintained in the reminder field, as this would be the earlier date.

The data maintained in the Business Configuration activity "Business Task Management for Contracts and Customer Returns" is what is considered always. In this activity, for the Activation Date, if you select the condition "Date and Time for Task Activation" then the Reminder days maintained in the Contract will be used. The system will check the Business Configuration settings when the contract is created or when the contract is renewed. The system will not send a reminder for a contract if nothing had been maintained in the Business Configuration when the contract first started or was last renewed. A change made in the Business Configuration afterwards will not be considered for the contract.

The task is only sent when the Contract Validity is Active.

Regards,

Arjun T H

SAP Product Support

entry.title: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods?
entry.content:
How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods when the wrong period is selected during a depreciation job?

For example, if the job for September has been completed and then the job for November was run directly.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted...
entry.content:
A new time interval needs to be added.

For instance, if an error occurs in November, we can add a new time interval on October 01 2025 in the app "Manage Fixed Assets". Then, adjust the depreciation key to 0000 and run the planned asset accounting job "Depreciation Posting - Period 11." Next, change the depreciation key back to its previous setting, and sequentially run the asset jobs "Depreciation Posting - Period 10" and "Depreciation Posting - Period 11."

3593095 - How to adjust depreciation values to post them into their respective periods after being posted together - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me

entry.title: Access FLP of S/4HANA Rise in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

 

Writing this blog after long analysis. I hope this will help community to fix the issue.

Requirement: Access the Fiori Launchpad of SAP S/4HANA Rise (Private Cloud) in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Analysis: In the Build Work Zone, standard edition site we need to add a new Role which should open the FLP of the S/4HANA system which is Private Cloud. SSO should work between Work Zone and Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA System.

Implementation: Below are the implementation steps in work zone:

1. Add the S/4HANA system in the Cloud Connector with https port

2. Configure the SSO using Principal Propagation so that it wont ask the credentials.

3. Set up the Custom IAS and SSO for Work Zone applicaiton.

4. Create a app, page, space, role in work zone and assing the role to user. PFA the app configuration which will use to connect Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA system. (App configuration for FLP in Work Zone.jpg)

Error: Once all the configuration in placed, we will access the FLP in the work zone and below error will come. PFA the error screenshot (Error when accessing FLP in Work Zone.jpg😞

Error

App could not be opened either due to an incorrect SAP Fiori launchpad configuration or a missing role assignment.

Solution: After lot of analysis not found any blog for this solution and finally found the solution by uncheck the property in the work zone app "Add intent and default SAP parameters to URL" and save. PFA the screen shot for same ()

After saving, access the FLP again and it open the Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA On Premise. PFA the working scenario (FLP of S4HANA working in Work Zone.jpg)

Please let me know your feedback if someone is able to fix the issue or having any other issue while configuriing the same.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Table line items not displaying in duplicated form copy (Adobe Form)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on an Adobe Form where my client requires a duplicate copy of the form within the same PDF.

I have duplicated the entire form object, and both the original and duplicate forms are bound to the same XML data source.

Here’s the issue:

  • The field values (scripted fields) are displaying correctly in PDF preview.

  • However, the table line items are displayed only in the original form and not in the duplicate form copy.

  • The duplicate form is bound to the same XML nodes, but the table data is not replicating dynamically. even though I have tried using scripting logic to force data refresh and rebind events.

Has anyone else faced this kind of issue before?
Would appreciate any suggestions or solutions to make the table data appear dynamically in both copies during preview or print.

Thanks in advance!
— Merushetha Kannan
SAP Forms service by Adobe SAP Interactive Forms by Adobe SAP BTP ABAP environment @XFA @adobe @SAPExpert JavaScript SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment

@EndUserText.label: 'Abstract Entity for File Stream'

  attachment            : /dmo/attachment;

}

entry.title: Re: Employee Central IBAN bank validation
entry.content:
Hi @Mikkelsen ,

The business rules framework unfortunately causes precision loss when converting a very large number of Java type Long. Long is used internally in the business rules framework when you use the "To Number()" function with the incoming String containing a large number. As a workaround, you can concatenate a ".0" to the String containing the large number. In this case, a decimal number will be generated by the "To Number()" function instead of a Long. As a result, no conversion is needed when you use for example the rule function "Modulo()" for this number.

entry.title: How to calculate monthly planned hours in Story Reports based on actual working days?
entry.content:
Good morning,

I’m working on a reporting scenario in SAP SuccessFactors where I need to calculate monthly planned working hours for employees in a query. The challenge is that the calculation should reflect the actual number of working days in the month, not just use a fixed average like 176.4 hours * FTE.

This assumes 21 working days per month (8.4 hours per day), which is only an approximation. However, actual working days vary by month.

Question:
How can we build a calculation in a Story Report or query that dynamically determines the correct number of working days per month and multiplies by daily hours and FTE? Any best practices or examples would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Alex

entry.title: Re: Employee Central IBAN bank validation
entry.content:
Hi @Mikkelsen ,

Unfortunately, the business rules cause precision loss if a very large number of Java type Long is converted. The Java type Long is used as the output of the rule function "To Number()" if the input is a String containing a very large number without decimal point. As a workaround, you can concatenate a ".0" to the String. In this case, "To Number()" returns a decimal type and no conversion is needed if you use this number for a rule function like "Modulo()".

entry.title: Re: Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience
entry.content:
Just to clarify, this upgrade is not optional. It will be deployed to all tenants during the next productive upgrade, which is about a week from now.
Once the upgrade is applied, sending cases to SAP will only be possible through the new Built-In Support. All references to “Send to Provider” will be removed from the legacy tool.

The first version of the legacy Built-In Support will still remain visible under Administrator → Cases. End users will still be able to create internal tickets there, and key users will still be able to support their end users.
However, creating cases to send to SAP will be exclusively available in the new Built-In Support.

Also, with this change, internal tickets and SAP tickets will be fully separated. Internal tickets remain in the legacy view, while SAP cases must be created and managed in the new Built-In Support.

Hi @RAHULSOMANI ,

This is not possible with the Universal Journal (ACDOCP for Planning) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. You can plan your budget on projects with SAP Analytics Cloud Planning. If you need it for availability control, you also need to specify a G/L Account in the budgeting process.

Check out business content for Integrated Financial Planning and Portfolio Financial Planning: 

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/42093f14b43c485fbe3adbbe81eff6c8/1ecd38d47e4a4cc5b373ac4633f85233.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: Re: SAP Business ByDesign Expense reports in new currency...
entry.content:
Hello
Please find the details below.
2723736 - How to Change the Company Currency in SAP Business ByDesign?

Change Company Currency in SAP Business ByDesign - SAP Community


Transfer employees to the new company

All employees must be transferred from the old to the new company. Unfortunately, “fire and re-hire” is the only option. I recommend to define a new termination reason, for example “Reorg” to see the transfers from the old to the new company.


For the Currency of the a coutnry can be changed / Managed in Configuration activties : Countries/Regions

Regards,

Harshal

entry.title: Customer Conversation — SAP IBP
entry.content:
SAP IBP – Real-Time Supply Chain Analytics and Stories K+S Group

Як компанії трансформують свої ланцюги постачання завдяки аналітиці в реальному часі?
Долучайтеся до Customer Conversation із K+S Group — міжнародною сировинною компанією, що впровадила SAP Integrated Business Planning (SAP IBP) для підвищення гнучкості, прозорості та швидкості прийняття рішень.

Дата: Вівторок, 25 листопада
Час: 16:30 (CET) 
Тривалість: 1.25 години
Галузь: Mill Products and Mining
Мова події: English
Доповідач: Fabian Traumer – Head of Customer Supply Chain, K+S Group

Подія створена для фахівців, які прагнуть зрозуміти, як інтегроване планування допомагає компаніям координувати попит і пропозицію, керувати складними виробничими мережами та підвищувати ефективність операцій.

Програма:

  • Огляд компанії K+S

  • Шлях упровадження SAP IBP

  • Основні висновки та переваги

  • Live Q&A

Ключові теми: Реальні приклади оптимізації виробництва; практичні результати від використання SAP IBP; інтерактивна дискусія з експертом K+S.

Реєструйтесь на подію!

Подія проводиться виключно для клієнтів SAP у форматі відкритої презентації, живої дискусії та сесії запитань і відповідей.

entry.title: Problem with access to new SAP Cloud Application Studio in C4C
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm working at C4C developing in Visual Studio 2022. As you know, since August of this year, what we knew as SAP Cloud Application Studio has become an extension within the Visual Studio program.

Now we've run into a problem: when SAP updates the development environments, we have a two-week window before the production environment is updated, and we don't have access to it, not even to view the code.

This problem arises because previously we had SAP Cloud Application Studio with both versions installed on our PCs, and we could access whichever one we wanted. Now we have to uninstall the extension with the old version and install the new version.

Does anyone have a solution to access the production environment during these two weeks?

My possible solutions are to set up a virtual machine on my PC with the older version or use a different PC.

entry.title: Split WT during Putaway 不启用HU包装管理，仓库上架根据单托重量拆分行上架需求开发是否有系统增强点
entry.content:
仓库上架根据单托重量拆分行上架需求开发是否有系统增强点，我们并未找到增强点，希望知道此需求的具体实现方式；期待您的回复，谢谢~

Translation In English:

No HU management, but we want to split the WT due to weight during putaway. Is there any BADI can be used?

Note: "WT Generic" is set as "Only Storage Type", the destination bin is not specified until WT confirmation.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Split WT during Putaway 不启用HU包装管理，仓库上架根据单托重量拆分行上架需求开发...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

As far as I know it is not possible to split the WT due to weight directly without capacity check for specific destination bin.

In your case, you may consider below workaround:

  1. Define alternative UoM for material.
  2. Set "Round to Whole Unit" as "Round Down WT Quantity as Single Unit" at Customizing "Maintain Storage Types" for source bin of putaway WT or set ti Round Whole Units at customizing "Define Warehouse Process Type".

For example, the Base Unit is PC and UoM conversion is set as 1 PAL = 5 PC.

Then when you create putaway task for requested quantity 12 PC, the putaway WT will be split as 5 + 5 + 2.

Hope it helps.

entry.title: Getting Started with the SAP Signavio Transformation Manager APIs: Initiatives & Insights
entry.content:
First Things First: What Are These APIs for? 

The SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager APIs, comprising the Initiatives API and Insights API, extend the capabilities of SAP Signavio Transformation Manager to developers, partners, and customers who want to integrate, automate, and scale transformation efforts programmatically. 

Use it when you need to: 

  • Create, read, update, or delete initiatives programmatically. 
  • Search, sort, or filter initiatives based on status, owner, or value driver. 
  • Maintain governance and access control through standardized endpoints. 
  • Create, read, update, or delete insights. 
  • Connect insights to one or more initiatives. 
  • Connect initiatives and insights seamlessly with project management tools, analytics platforms, or custom applications.  

How Do I Access the APIs? 

Similar to SAP Signavio Process Manager APIs, it uses token-based authentication, so you don’t even need to copy cookies! The Transformation Manager APIs use token-based authentication and the same setup steps for technical users and license assignments. 

Currently, a Transformation Hub User provides full CRUD API access under a paid customer license, while all workspace users can perform read (GET) operations at no cost, and write actions (POST, PUT, DELETE) on Initiatives, Insights, Objectives, and Tasks require a Transformation Manager license (see attached screenshot). 

💡Tip: For additional information please check out Getting Started with SAP Signavio Process Manager API Blog Post.  

How Do I Obtain a Token? 

Before we start exploring the API endpoints, let’s first look at how to authenticate and obtain your token.  

Request: 

POST https://{{host}}/auth/v1/token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

You can find the correct host in the SAP Help documentation. 

Form Parameters: 

tokenonly=true
name=<your_email_address>
password=<your_password>
tenant=<workspace_tenant_id>

Response:
If successful, the API returns 200 OK, and the JWT is provided directly in the response body. If authentication fails, you may receive: 

  • 400 Bad Request: Incorrect parameter format (e.g., password sent as query string). 
  • 401 Unauthorized: Invalid credentials. 
  • 302 Found: Returned when tokenonly=true is omitted. 

Usage:
Include the JWT in the header for all subsequent API requests:

x-signavio-id: <your_token>

💡Tip: You can find your workspace tenant ID in SAP Help documentation. Tokens remain valid for 8 hours, so request a new one after expiry to continue using the API. 

What Are the Key Entities in the APIs? 

After obtaining your token, you can start creating and managing initiatives and insights programmatically. 

Understanding the main entities helps you navigate both APIs more easily. In essence, the Transformation Manager APIs revolve around a few key objects: 

  • Initiatives: Represent transformation programs or projects that drive organizational change. 
  • Insights: Capture process findings or improvement ideas identified during analysis.

Dig Into Specific Requests and Responses

Once you’ve set up authentication, you can start creating new initiatives directly through the API. Let’s look at how to do this with the Initiatives API.

Example 1: Create a New Initiative

The creation endpoint is a simple POST request to:

https://{{host}}/transformationmanager/v1/initiatives

You can find the correct host in the SAP Help documentation.

Request:

POST https://{{host}}/transformationmanager/v1/initiatives
Authorization: Bearer <your_token>
Content-Type: application/json

Body:

{
  "name": "Digital Supply Chain Optimization",
  "description": "End-to-end program to improve delivery times and reduce logistics cost.",
  "status": "PLANNING",
  "valueDrivers": [
"REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST", 
"IMPROVE_ON_TIME_DELIVERY"
],
  "authorizations": [
    {
      "targetType": "USER",
      "targetId": "<user_UUID>",
      "role": "OWNER"
    }
  ]
}

 Note: The status and valueDrivers fields accept only predefined values (for example, PLANNING, COMPLETED, REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST). For the full list, see the SAP Help documentation.

💡Tip: To create or update Insights and Initiatives, you need the UUID of the technical user used for the API.  Since there’s no public endpoint for user details, you can find this UUID directly in SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub:

  1. Go to Settings ➔ User management.
  2. Search and select the technical user that’s used for the API.
  3. Copy the UUID from the browser URL. It appears as:
    https://editor.signavio.com/.../users/<UUID
  4. Use this UUID in your API payloads under the authorizations.targetId or assignees field.

Response:

{ 
  "id": "<initiative_UUID>", 
  "name": "Digital Supply Chain Optimization",
  "status": "PLANNING",
  "type": "STANDARD", 
  "valueDrivers": [
    "REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST", 
    "IMPROVE_ON_TIME_DELIVERY" 
  ], 
  "authorizations": [ 
     { 
       "target": { 
         "id": "<user_UUID>", 
         "displayName": "John Doe"
      }, 
      "targetType": "USER", 
      "role": "OWNER"
    }
  ],
  "dateCreated": "2025-11-03T13:15:32Z" 
}

💡Tip: You can automate initiative creation when a new opportunity or improvement program is approved in your project management or analytics tool. Simply trigger this endpoint with your system’s event to keep SAP Signavio Transformation Manager in sync automatically.

Now, let’s move to filtering insights, another key operation you can perform once your initiatives are created.

Example 2:  Filter Insights with Multiple Parameters

This is a simple GET request to:

https://{{host}}/transformationmanager/v1/insights?status=OPEN&valueDriver=REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST&nameContains=Delivery&sortBy=dateCreated&sortOrder=Descending&pageSize=3
Authorization: Bearer <your_token> 
Content-Type: application/json

In this example, the request retrieves all insights where the status is OPEN,the valueDriver includes REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST, and the name contains the term “Delivery”.  The results are sorted by creation date in descending order, showing the most recently created insights first. The pageSize=3 parameter limits the response to three insights for demonstration purposes.

Make sure you use the correct host from the SAP Help documentation, similar to the previous example.

Response:

{ 
  "id": "<insight_UUID>", 
  "name": "Delivery Route Optimization",
  "description": "Reducing logistics costs by improving delivery route efficiency",
  "status": "OPEN", 
  "valueDrivers": [
    "REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST", 
    "IMPROVE_ON_TIME_DELIVERY" 
  ], 
  "impactScore": 8.2, 
   "effortScore": 3.5,
   "priorityScore": 9.0,
   "assignees": [ 
     { 
       "id": "<user_UUID>", 
       "displayName": "John Doe"
       "email": "john.doe@example.com",
  ],
  "authorizations": [ 
     { 
       "target": { 
         "id": "<user_UUID>", 
         "displayName": "John Doe"
      }, 
      "targetType": "USER", 
      "role": "OWNER"
    }
  ],
  "dateCreated": "2025-10-12T14:32:00Z" 
  "dateUpdated": "2025-11-03T13:15:32Z"
}

 

What Happens When Things Go Wrong?

Sooner or later, an API call might fail, but the good news is, Transformation Manager gives you clear responses and tools to troubleshoot.

Here are a few quick tips to keep in mind:

  1. Check the response code
    Most errors use standard HTTP codes:
  • 400: Invalid request or missing field
  • 401: Invalid or expired token
  • 403: Not enough permissions
  • 404: Resource not found

       2. Verify your authentication token
       If you see 401, make sure your JWT hasn’t expired (tokens are valid for 8 hours). Simply request a new one via /auth/v1/token.

       3. Confirm your workspace access
       A 403 often means the technical user doesn’t have the correct role or license. Check authorization settings in your Signavio     workspace.

        4. Inspect the request payload
        For 400 errors, validate your JSON body. Field names, value types, and nesting must match the API schema.

If the issue persists, open a support ticket in SAP for Me for BPI-SIG-CA-II component, and include your tenant ID, request body, and response log to speed up investigation. 

Don’t Forget About Rate Limits

Usage of Transformation Manager APIs is monitored to ensure reliable performance and fair access for all tenants. To prevent overload, rate limits define how many requests your applications can send within a given time window. You can find detailed thresholds and best practices in the SAP Help Documentation. 

Summary & Best Practices

The SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager APIs provide a powerful way to extend Transformation Manager programmatically from managing initiatives and insights to integrating with analytics and project management systems.

Here are a few tips to make the most of them:

  • Use technical users only
    Always authenticate with a dedicated technical user holding an API Edition license. Avoid personal accounts for better security and maintainability.
  • Reuse tokens efficiently
    Tokens remain valid for 8 hours. Cache and reuse them within that window instead of requesting new ones for every API call.
  • Keep initiatives and insights in sync
    Link insights to initiative IDs to maintain end-to-end traceability between analysis, planning, and execution.
  • Monitor and automate
    Use health check endpoints in your CI/CD pipelines or monitoring dashboards to detect issues early and ensure consistent uptime.
  • Use enums and structured data
    Define and reuse enums for fields like status and valueDriver to maintain consistency across systems.
  • Paginate and sort server-side
    When working with large datasets, always apply pagination and sorting through API parameters for better performance.
  • Link related assets
    Associate dashboards, process models, or tasks via the AssetEntity field to ensure end-to-end traceability.

✨Together, these practices help you build stable, efficient integrations, and make the most out of the Transformation Manager APIs within your SAP Signavio landscape.

Join the Developer Community

Have a question? Built something cool? Share it via signavio_ecosystem@sap.com!

The SAP Signavio developer community is a growing space where users share what they’ve built, ask questions, and exchange best practices. Whether you're stuck on a request, looking for inspiration, or want to showcase your latest integration, this is the place to be.

🧠 Make sure to check out our blog posts for more ideas and insights.

Thanks for reading! 🎉

I hope this guide gave you a solid foundation to start building and maybe even sparked some ideas along the way.

entry.title: Re: Plan for migration of interfaces to SAP Cloud Integra...
entry.content:
Helo Ramu,

Based on my experience, I’d see the following:

(i) You might have multiple pipelines running in your tenant. Although I haven’t yet encountered a scenario with separate pipelines per team, I have seen multiple pipelines used for distinct messages with different priorities, or to segregate scenarios containing sensitive data. If teams should not see or operate on messages from other teams, then yes, that setup would be beneficial.

(ii) Normally, customers migrate system by system. However, this depends on whether you have single interfaces operating across multiple plants and whether that would have any operational impact.

(iii) There is no one-size-fits-all guidance here, especially for areas such as Resource Management. If you’ll have multiple teams working within the same SAP Integration Suite tenant, it’s important to start with good governance and clearly define access policies, naming conventions, and related standards.

To stablish a good governance, I'd recommend to look at the ISA-M: https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-guidance-framework/sap-integration-solution-advisory-methodology/sap-integration-solution-advisory-methodology-overview?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

More specifically for user accesses and policies, I'd recommend the links below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/configuring-user-access?version=CLOUD
https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/identity-and-access-management?version=CLOUD
https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/managing-access-policies?version=CLOUD


Finally, I'd recommend to take a look on the Migration Guide at the "Landscape" section, and also make sure test and get confidence how to operate with one or multiple pipelines. That will accelerate how you migrate interfaces in the long-term
https://help.sap.com/docs/migration-guide-po/migration-guide-for-sap-process-orchestration/migration-guide-sap-process-orchestration?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: Re: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom...

entry.title: Re: Delivery Class for T012
entry.content:
Hi, the change is documented in this note: 3404617 - T012D | Delivery class had been changed from C to A - SAP for Me. Title says T012D, but the text mentions also T012.

Regards, Ingo

entry.title: Re: SAP BPA Updating API specification deletes all previous Actions
entry.content:
Spoke to the team at SAP TechEd and they acknowledged that this is a bug in the tool. Will be raising a customer influence request and will share it here so we can get this resolved.

Regards,

Melwyn

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Email Alert Configuration
entry.content:
It doesn't matter if you configure email settings in SLD or in General settings. The option to set it up in General settings only enables you to define it for each company separately, while SLD setup is valid for all companies on the server.

Regarding prerequisites, there are few:

1. Obviously you need to enable comminication between SLD and SMTP server via port that is used for SMTP (usually 587, but that is for you to know). What security layers you need to configure, that is also for you to know as it is your environment.

2. Your SMTP server needs to be enabled for third party apps connection. Might be a different name, but it's a setting that enables various apps to connect to SMTP and use it to send emails.

3. AlertSvc user (or Workflow on more recent versions) should not be locked, should be marked superuser and shuld have a default language selected (one of the system languages, not custom language).

4. When you connect to SMTP, you connect via certain user credentials that you set up in SLD, for example sld@test.com. Email address used for sending alerts is the one defined in company details, general tab. If these two emails are not the same, for example you set company@test.com in Company details, then you need to make sure that sld@test.com account has authorization to send emails on behalf of company@test.com. 

Never had an issue after I set all of these points up.
